title: File
name: File
description:
Handles all interactions with files. The attributes you use with cffile depend on the value of the action attribute.
 For example, if the action = "write", use the attributes associated with writing a text file.

attributes.name: storeacl
attributes.description:
An array of struct where each struct represents a permission or grant.
Example:
[{email="xxx@yyy.com", permission="full_control"}, {group="all", permission="read"}]

attributes.name: action
attributes.description: Type of file manipulation that the tag performs.

attributes.name: serverpassword
attributes.description: allow you to access filesystem, also when access is denied for your context

attributes.name: source
attributes.description:
Absolute pathname of file on web server.
On Windows, use backward slashes; on UNIX, use forward slashes.

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.description:
One attribute (Windows) or a comma-delimited list of attributes (other platforms) to set on the file.
If omitted, the file's attributes are maintained.

attributes.name: destination
attributes.description: Absolute pathname of directory or file on web server.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: Applies only to Solaris and HP-UX. Permissions. Octal values of UNIX chmod command. Assigned to owner, group, and other, respectively.

attributes.name: filefield
attributes.description: Name of form field used to select the file.

attributes.name: charset
attributes.description: Character set name for the file contents.

attributes.name: nameconflict
attributes.description: Action to take if filename is the same as that of a file in the directory.

attributes.name: accept
attributes.description: list of supported extensions or/and mimetypes.

attributes.name: strict
attributes.description:
for action "upload" and "uploadAll":
   if set to true (default), only mimetypes are supported.

attributes.name: createPath
attributes.description:
for action "append", "touch" and "write":
   if set to false (default), expects all parent directories to exist, true will generate necessary directories

attributes.name: file
attributes.description: Absolute pathname of file on web server.

attributes.name: variable
attributes.description: Name of variable to contain contents of text file.

attributes.name: output
attributes.description: Content of the file to be created.

attributes.name: addNewLine
attributes.description: Yes: appends newline character to text written to file

attributes.name: fixnewline
attributes.description:
- true: changes embedded line-ending characters in string
            variables to operating-system specific line endings
            - false: (default) do not change embedded line-ending
            characters in string variables.
